page.title: 05BRADWELL PARISH COUNCIL
page.content: The work of the council is carried out by various committees. Here are some examples. The{Housing and Planning Committee deals with planning applications for new buildings or extensions. The{Community Facilities Development {Committee}is responsible for the upkeep of the playing fields, footpaths and seats. The{Poor Marsh Trustees}administer the poor marsh. In 1895 a piece of land, about four acres in all, was acquired by the parish council. This land was let every year for grazing and the money was used to buy coal for the poor of the parish every Christmas. Nowadays, money is given instead of coal. In 1984 six people were given Â£10 at Christmas.
